Posts.Content: Hi Michelle,        I will be thinking of you on Monday and hoping that all goes well for you. Someone told me to try to keep my mind occupied so that there isn't time to dwell on everything. I know that is easier said than done, but I find a few minutes without thinking about what is to come is some relief. All the best and stay strong. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Kaz     Thank you for your support. I have to just try to stick to what I have chosen, but I'm really scared like everyone was /is. I don't know where everyone is finding that inner strength from. I guess that knowing that others have come out the other side gives one hope. I am hoping that when my turn comes on the 8th I will be able to think about all of you and know that I can do it too. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Zena         Thank you for replying. I hadn't thought of it being worse than when I had the biopsy. I assumed that it would take some time to develop further. I think I still have a chance of having the calcification tested to see if they are cancerous before I decide. I guess I'll  have to be guided more by the consultant and not just take the easiest option. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi liz      I am sorry to hear of your diagnosis, but I know you will get lots of support from people here. They all offer great support and good advice. It took a little while to come to the forum after my initial diagnosis as I just kept crying and worrying what I would do. Then I looked through the booklets I was given and here I am. Ask everyone anything you want to know and I am sure you will get reassuring answers. Thinking of you Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Joan and everyone helping me,                                                    Thank you all for your replies and words of wisdom and encouragement. I saw my consultant today and I am having a mastectomy on 8th Nov. I thought about just having the lump and some of the calcifications removed, but he seemed to be saying that if the calcification was suspect then it could have spread out further which would mean there wouldn't be a clear margin and I would then have to have a mastectomy. It still seems a bit as though I could take a chance, but then I thought that I wouldn't want a second operation, so I went for the mastectomy. All I need now is all of your positive attitudes to rub off on me for the days ahead. I have really valued your support in these times and hope that I haven't been too much of a nuisance. I hope that when my experience is over I will be able to support others in similar circumstances. Look after yourselves all of you Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Janet        We enjoyed our lunch out yesterday and also had a few minute sitting by the sea and watching the tankers. It was high tide and fairly rough which went perfectly with how I was feeling. I am still thinking about just removing the lump and seeing if that will be enough. Then perhaps if I start to feel less depressed and generally stronger and I need further surgery I could have it.  Thank you for all of the information about the nodes and tests. I have been trying to think about positive things and I guess yesterday was one of them. Hope all is well with you Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Joan   Thank you for your reply. It sounds like a good idea for extra medication. I might also be able to see a clinical psychologist to give me some talking therapy. I am seeing my GP this afternoon to see what he can sort out. Time is passing too quickly when I don't really feel ready for what is ahead. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Zena,        Thank you for your kind words. I went shopping with my husband this morning and found myself rushing out of the shop in tears. I just got into a panic about going out and imagining myself after the operation. What thoughts did you have Zena before going out again? Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Debra,         Thank you for replying. I hope I will be like you and be up and about. I do have a poster with six exercises on but I wasn't sure if they were for just a mastectomy or for node clearance which I don't want. I was interested in what you said about bras as I don't want to wear one to start with and was a bit scared to ask if that would be alright. When I had the lumpectomy on the other breast I had to wear a bra to help the healing, but with a mastectomy it won't be necessary. Does the prothesis go in a sort of pocket in the proper mastectomy bras? Does the breast care nurse give you the prothesis size to match the other breast or what? Sorry for all the questions, but I have tried to put off finding out anything about all of this. It is a bit like out of sight out of mind. I can't get my head round all of it. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Janet,          Well I've cleaned the house from top to bottom. I'm thinking of making some biscuits and tarts later. I've done all my Christmas shopping and just wrapped the last present.  I don't want my husband to have anything at all to do except the housework and cooking and washing! I think that will be enough. He had a nightmare last night and woke up shouting. He is worried that it isn't really what I want and that I am just being swept along with Doctors/consultants and relatives opinions and he feels he is part of it. He has always said that he would support my decision, but he feels that this isn't really my decision and that I am making it for the wrong reasons. I'm not sure that he isn't right. I have often considered trying the lumpectomy first and  if that is no good go for the mastectomy. The only problem is that I would need a second operation. I still find myself weighing up the pros and cons, but the solution isn't really good whichever way I play it. I seem to be determined to fight this decision to the end, but why? is what I can't understand. When I read everyone else's stories they seem to be putting their energies into fighting the cancer, whereas my energy is in fighting my decision. How mad is that!  Thank you Janet for the information and keeping with me. I know I'm a nightmare. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone,             I had right breast cancer 5 years ago and had lumpectomy and nodes checked  and nothing else as too scared. Now cancer lump and calcifications in left breast.  Feeling sacred about choosing a mastectomy which the Doctors have said I should have. Not having nodes checked because I had them checked on the right side and don't want 2 arms that I can't have blood tests etc in. Doctors said I would have 2 drains and a drip in my ankle after the operation if I had nodes checked as well. As I won't have chemo or radiotherapy because I 'm too scared I think it is a waste of time checking the nodes. If I have a mastectomy will that mean the cancer has gone from the breast and chest area? Any words of wisdom would be helpful as I have to tell the consultant tomorrow which operation I will have on 27th. Thanks
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi.  Thanks for taking time to reply. I have to make my choice today and I guess it will have to be the mastectomy. I wanted to hear other people's opinions because I already have ME and depression so I think I look at things in the wrong way. I'm glad things are going well for you at present. All the best
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Gillianatherton                Thanks for reply. I'm glad you are coming out the other side although you have further treatments to come. I think I will ask a few more questions today before making that final decision. If our knowledge was 100% then it would be easier to make a decision, but some of the choices seem to be made just in case cancer has spread or the calcification will create cancer. My had has been in a spin with it all. To hear that you are still living life after it all gives me some encouragement. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi All,    I seem to have had a panic last night and I am thinking that I can't go through with the mastectomy. I am seeing my consultant on Friday and have to discuss things again. I keep thinking that I could have a lumpectomy and take a chance with the rest of the calcification in the breast. Has anyone else had calcification and left it to see what might happen? I know that it only takes one rogue cell to develop into cancer, but I thought I heard that it could take 5 to 10 years. Has anyone any advice please? Friday keeps getting closer and I just don't know what choice to make now. The more time I have to make a decision, the worse it is getting. Thanks to all who read this Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Zena,         Thank you for replying. I think I am worried about being treated differently or being thought of as different. In some ways it seems easier to deal with people who don't know, but I kept thinking that they would know there was something different. I was pleased to read what you said and I am trying to put it as a positive thing to think about. Obviously it isn't easy though. Another thought I have is that I will know that I will be different and I have lots of sweatshirts and fleeces to make sure I am covered. The trouble is the fear keeps taking over at the moment and trying to take everyone's positivity is difficult. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Janet,      Thank you for replying. I feel as though I am weakening again. In a way it is getting worse as the operation gets closer. I seem to just be thinking of how I can get out of it. My mind is running riot again. Perhaps some of you could answer a question I have-Did you all have the nodes checked under your arm and did you all have to have radio or chemo? I decided that I am having none of them and so I am wondering if the operation will be a waste of time. If you had radio or chemo was it because the nodes weren't clear or was it due to results of the mastectomy. Is there any testing of the mastectomy tissue?  I can't remember what I was told as II expect I was told something. I am going out to lunch today to a carvery restaurant with sea views. I hope I don't start crying, as that's what I tend to do if I'm out at the moment. Thanks again Janet for your positivity Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Janet,          I saw the GP and I am back on the mastectomy road even though I don't like it. I suddenly thought about something stupid that I wanted to know. Do you feel unbalanced on one side or heavy on one side? I'm only small but after the last operation the breast is a bit sort of sagging without a bra. I can't imagine what it will feel like with nothing on the other side and not wearing a bra for a while. I think I had a sort of boob tube bandage last time and I thought about it this time. Thanks for your advice. I will try to keep going until Monday. I have to be in at 7:30, but I expect there will be a long wait. All the best Sharon                     ;30, but I expect there will be a long wait.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Mia,       Thank you for your reply. I  think I will ask a few more questions today when I see the consultant and make my choice. You all seem so brave I'm not sure I am. It seems from what everyone is saying that I need to go for the mastectomy. I hope all goes well with you. All the best Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Kay      Thank you for replying. I think my depression stops me thinking about recovery as that hasn't entered my head once. I just think about the choices and being able to cope with the choice I make. I will probably have the mastectomy as the Doctors say and take a chance on leaving the nodes alone. Best wishes to you Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi  Aunico           Thank you for replying. You sound so brave going through the treatments. I'm not sure I can be like that. I think I will ask my last questions today and then perhaps decide on the mastectomy. I think I'll take a chance on the nodes being clear. I just don't want to make a fool of myself when I go into hospital feeling scared. I hope all goes well for you and you continue toenjoy  any pampering given to you-you certainly deserve it. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Marian and all following my posts,                                                          I have got myself in a right mess. Firstly I need to explain that I have ME/chronic fatigue syndrome and I have depression and anxiety. The Doctors seem to think that t all stemmed from my first bout of cancer. I seem to be very weak and am only 6stones in weight now. When I saw my consultant to say that I would have the mastectomy suddenly he said that he thought that I wasn't able to make that decision and cancelled the operation. My husband was not pleased and I was so upset that I ran out of the room. It was left with nothing happening. My husband has written a complaint to the hospital and they phoned me yesterday to apologise and said that they would investigate. That leaves me sitting at home wondering and waiting about what will happen next. I am even more scared than I was as I am not sure that I want to go back to that consultant and there isn't really another at that hospital. I just feel so tired and worn out by the whole thing. It is somewhat reassuring to know that all of you are getting through your treatment and being able to move on with your lives. I hope that all goes well in the future. Thank you to anyone who reads this Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Janet,   I saw my GP today as suggested and he talked it all through with me and is going to get another operation date arranged for me to have the mastectomy. I'm still a bit unsure if I should just have the cancer lump removed only, but then the calcifications can turn to cancer in the future. So I guess it is partly a prevention operation. It is all very difficult making decisions and all of our cancers are different. It's amazing!  Thank you for replying. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Joan    Thank you for replying. I hope I can be positive like you sound. The trouble is that after the operation, chemo, radio etc, it is the normal day to day things that we all have to try to deal with. I guess if you can be positive it all becomes easier to handle. I worry that I might be like your friend too scared to touch my scarred area. Thank you again for your helpful reply. Best wishes to you. Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Vicky Thank you so much for your reply. You sound so brave and it makes me wonder if I could ever be like that. The problem with depression is that the negative thoughts just take over and make decision making very difficult. That is why I seem to be constantly changing my mind. When I am feeling stronger and have read people's posts, then I think I can do that. But at the moment I am constantly crying which is really getting me down because I know that won't get me through having an operation. When the decision time comes tomorrow, I don't know what I will say. Thank you again for your reply. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Joan       Thank you for your reply                                          Everyone will be getting fed up with me and my indecision. The trouble is the longer you have to keep thinking about the best option the worse it is. Depression brings me down and I am in a bad phase at the moment and the ME makes me so  tired. I keep falling asleep in the afternoons. These prblems just make me wonder how I will cope afterwards. You all seem so strong and are managing to come out the other side. I'm not sure where I will find the strength I need. I will listen again to the consultant and hope I can make a good choice tomorrow. Thank you again Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Janet,  Thank you for replying. What you say is absolutely true. I had already started getting the house cleaned from top to bottom in readiness for my previous operation date. I will have to start over. I have already started to think about changing my mind and want to cancel it on Monday. I just feel that I want some peace and not have to think about being ill. The trouble with the cancer is that there don't appear to be symptoms whereas the ME and depression create havoc. If I go through with the operation, I just see it as adding more problems to my body and I don't know where I will get the strength from to keep going. I am trying to say 'stop', as you suggest but my mind is running riot.  I will try hard to keep away from the phone on Monday , but coping isn't easy. All the best Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Joan,       Thank you for your support. It will be a long week, but we have a few visitors this week and I'm going out to lunch on Friday for my birthday. I'm not sure if it is a good or bad thing. I am finding normal life a bit difficult and it feels a bit like living through a fog. Everything becomes jumbled and then the fear of the future takes over and that is that. I want to make an effort as my husband hasn't seen his friend for a while and he lost his wife to cancer several years ago. I think it will be a good support for my husband as I know it is difficult. I feel bad for taking everybody's time, but I think I will need to read thse posts throughout the week. Thanks again Joan Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Barbara,      Thank you for replying. It was comforting to read your reply. I think that I seem to have that nagging doubt that I could just have the lumpectomy, but reading what you say, I guess realistically I have to have a mastectomy. Are you managing to get out and feeling alright about it? (not that you shouldn't be, but I think you will know what I mean). This is what I am thinking that I won't be able to do. I imagine people will know and I keep thinking that I won't go out again.  I hope that your radio therapy goes well and that you are not too tired. I'll be thinking of you. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Janet          Thank you for sticking with me. Every time I am writing on here I am in floods of tears. I think about everyone here and how brave everyone is and how you all seem to be getting on with your lives. One problem I have is that I keep remembering my lumpectomy operation 5 years ago. I nearly didn't make that operation. I got to the operating theatre with no medication and decided that I wouldn't both and was half off the bed and trying to go. All of the theatre staff came out and my consultant tried to persuade me to stay. Someone said quickly drink this and then a mask was put on me and I was gone. It is so vivid in my mind that I can't see how I am going to be able to do it again. This time it feels worse because it is a mastectomy. I still have the same consultant and he knows I found it hard, but when it comes down to it, it is me that has to do it.  All day today I kept thinking if it was next Monday then this could be happening or that could have happened and then I just start crying. It still seems that the easiest thing is to cancel it and just take my chances. My mind is in a turmoil and I can't concentrate on one thing. I was trying to do about five things at once this morning. Now I have completely exhausted myself I thought I would read the posts. I have thought about seeing my Gp, but time seems to be running out. Thank you again for your advice Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Celia,         Thank you for replying. This week is going too quickly and I feel that I am running out of time and options. I wish that I could just accept that I need this operation and get on with it. I am still thinking about just removing the lump and see what happens. It was comforting to read that after the operation you were less tearful than before. I guess it is a little bit to do with going into the unknown. I can see that the verse you quoted was very apt. I hope things continue to go well for you. Look after yourself Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Zena,          Thank you for replying. I think that I am better thinking about other people than giving time and effort to myself. On Sunday I could forget all about things as an elderly neighbour had a fall in the garden and my husband and I rushed to help. I got towels to staunch the bleeding and waited for the ambulance. I was cleaning up for her and she said that I had enough to worry about without her. I just find times like that much easier because it isn't to do with yourself.  I guess this is where the keeping busy and having positives like your daughter getting married are a help. It is when I have time to think that it all goes wrong. Sorry to hear about your daughter and depression. Hope all goes well. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Joan,       Thank you for the reply. I am just keeping busy with housework etc. I want everything sorted before Monday. My husband seems rather down today is very worried for me. He knows that it hasn't been an easy decision, but wants to make everything go away. Unrealistic I know, but that's men for you!  I'm not sure that I want him there straight after I wake up, as I will need time to come to terms with the changes to my body. I still have worries and just hope that they don't bombard me on Monday. Thank you for your support. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Kaz     Thank you for replying. It seems that you managed to keep calm when you woke up which is what worries me somewhat as there is no going back. I only hope I will have your strength to be like that. I guess that means II have sort of decided to go ahead with the mastectomy on 27th. I will ask a few more questions today when I see the consultant. All the best to you Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Joan     I hope you won't mind me asking you as it seems a daft question, but is it numb for ever after the mastectomy. I know my arm is where I had the lymph nodes checked before. I am thinking about washing after  the mastectomy and having that horrible numb feeling for ever. I know this must sound daft when I have cancer, but I guess it is the silly things that keep us going. Hope all is well with you Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Janet           Thank you for your reply. I think you are right when you talk about choosing the right option and not the easiest. I think I am trying to take the easiest option, because I have previously had a lumpectomy on the other breast I know I coped with that. The scar was ok but as it is at the top of the breast I never wore anything that revealed any part of my chest agian, because the scar would be seen. I always wear t shirts that cover it up. I was left with a bad body image and although I am only 6stone in weight constantly worry about my size and shape. If Ihave the mastectomy I just don't know how I will cope with looking at my body. That's why I was asking about numbness and washing/showering etc. Depression doesn't help with thoughts about myself, it's not because I'm vain or anything, just the complete opposite. When I hear all of your stories I just think about the bravery you all show in the face of adversity. I just hope that some of it will rub off on me. All the best Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Barbara,                 Thank you for your reply. It is lovely to hear that you are getting out and about and I was so thrilled to hear about your support from the cricket club. It is a strange coincidence when talking to people as my husband used to play cricket and I did the scoring for his matches. I try to keep positive when I have read things here,but then all the negativity starts and I keep thinking I only have a few days left before I have changed for ever. I keep imagining what I will look like and what it would be like to see myself in a mirror when washing. It just makes me feel sick and then I think I can't go through with it. I try to listen to what you are all telling me and I guess I need to look more at the end point than what we all have to go through to get there. I hope all goes well with your radio therapy Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Debra,    Thank you for all of the information. It was all very useful to know how it really is and not basic practicalities you seem to get told. I seem to finding this week to quickest passing time I have ever known. I am still very much dreading Monday. I just hope that I can be strong like all of you are. It seems that every day more people have to join the fight, but luckily there are people like everyone here to help. I think it is better hearing the real truth from those who have been through it. I know we are all different and have different techniques to manage trauma, but it is of some comfort to know we are not alone. I have found myself looking at people in the street and wondering what they are suffering quietly behind closed doors. Best wishes Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Jill      Thank you for your reply. I hope you don't mind if I ask a question-How did you know what grade the cancer was before the operation? I seem to only know I have a breast cancer lump and calcification in different places.  I hope I can be like you with positive thoughts after the operation. I am also scared of the thought of looking at the scar. When I just write that it makes me cry. I am glad that the rest of your care is going well and that you can be pleased with the results. Look after yourself Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Maggie,      Thank you for your support. I am finding that indecision is a terrible thing, and that if anyone is in this position they somehow need to find their solution and be able stick with it. If I could really say that I would be able to go for reconstruction afterwards then some of my fears would be less. However this is not a course of action suited to me and so I have the worry of looking odd and with some padding at times. My husband has said that it will make no difference to him, but I feel like I'm letting him down in some way. Oh well it is all too late now and Monday is getting closer. Thank you again for thinking of me Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: To all of my friends and followers,                                                     Thank you all for your support and good wishes. I only hope that I can live up to all of the faith you have in me. Thank you for answering all of my questions and nagging doubts. I have yet again cleaned the house from top to bottom and I am just hoping the washing will dry so I can iron it all. I need to keep busy because those doubts and thoughts of how I will be afterwards are very high profile. Our son is arriving tonight and I am hoping that he will provide support for my husband tomorrow. I know that he is suffering with me as he feels he can't protect me as he should. If the emotions could be taken out of these situations they would be much easier to deal with. I just hope that I won't get too emotional tomorrow. To anyone else out there who is undergoing any form of treatment I send my best wishes and hope that we can all find some comfort in the fact that others are going through it too and that many have come out the other side. Best wishes and thanks to you all Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone,           I am feeling very depressed, ashamed, weak and as if I let everyone down. I should have had my mastectomy on Monday, but instead I had a massive panic attack and was unable to have the operation. I was running and jumping with my heart pounding and crying a lot. I got to the  5th floor  and could go no further. I sat on the window sill and shook and cried and gasped for breath. I sat there for nearly an hour and then my consultant arrived for work. He saw me and took me by the hand and said come up with me. I managed to get to the 7th floor and was shown my little room. He sat with me for a long time and talked about if it was the best choice for me. I kept thinking that I should be doing it, but I couldn't seem to make myself say yes. He got the nurse to come so that he could get on with the first operation and he said he would see me later. To cut a long story short, I stayed there all day debating the best course of action. It was thought that the lumpectomy and calcification removal might be better for my mental health. I am thus going to try again on 29th Nov as a day patient. I feel that  I let everyone down who has tried to help me and I am sorry for that. I hope that the rest of you going through this are stronger than I was. Best wishes everyone Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: To Everyone who read my posts. Thank you and goodbye I won't bother you again. This will be my last post and although I was grateful for your help, support and opinions obviously tangodancer thinks that I am upsetting you. I would hate to do that. I'm sorry if that was the case, but I thought that people chose to read and/or reply and I hope I hadn't made anyone think that they had to reply. For those of my friends I hope that all goes well for you all and I am glad that you have the strength and courage that I am obviously  lacking. To tango dancer I would just like to say that my surgeon and doctors have a better understanding and compassion for stress and anxiety than you obviosly have and they have said that they will get me through this whatever it takes. Thanks for the put down it has really made me feel better ! To my friends again I say thank you and please don't think badly of me. Good luck all of you. Sharon
Posts.Title: Mastectomy or not?

Posts.Content: Hi,  Just to say I'm thinking of you and your journey for treatment. I didn't take Tamoxifen or have radio as I was nervous of the side effects. I have lasted 5 years until this new lump on the other side. My sister has taken the tomoxifen and she said she had hot sweats, but she managed to laugh it off by saying we can do a bit of heat can't we? I doubt if this will help much, but I'm thinking of you. Sharon
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy, tamoxifen and zoladex
